Pre-Game Insights: India will be eagerly pursuing the twin goals of a series sweep and monitoring the progress of impressive second-line players during the third and final T20 against Bangladesh on Saturday, October 12, 2024.
India have already bagged the series 2-0 after wins at Gwalior and New Delhi.
Gautam Gambhir and his colleagues in the backroom have set in motion the process of finding able support cast to frontline players keeping in mind the long-term goals such as the ICC event next year.
Gambhir wants to take a closer look at players like pacer Mayank Yadav and spinner Varun Chakravarthy to assess their readiness for future challenges.
The team management will also keep a close eye on the journey of Nitish Kumar Reddy, who was highly impressive in the Delhi T20 while smashing a 34-ball 74 and returning with a couple of wickets.
The outings of Sanju Samson and Abhishek Sharma have been disappointing, and they will need to perform better to stay in the management's consideration.
The team think-tank will decide whether to hand a match to other worthy names on the bench like leg-spinner Ravi Bishnoi and all-rounder Harshit Rana.
Bangladesh will strive to taste that elusive victory on this tour, needing consistent effort from seniors like captain Najmul Hossain Shanto, Litton Das, and Mustafizur Rahman.
